content:
Dell Inspiron laptops are popular models, and DDR4 RAM is a common type used in many modern laptops.

To determine the speed of your current RAM, you can check your laptop's documentation or online specifications. You can also check the RAM modules themselves, usually located on the bottom or side of your laptop. The speed is usually printed on the RAM module, and it might look something like "DDR4 2400MHz" or "DDR4 2133MHz".

Assuming your laptop uses DDR4 RAM and you have a free slot available, here are some 8GB DDR4 RAM module options that should be compatible:

* Crucial 8GB DDR4 2400MHz SODIMM RAM (around $35-$45)
* Corsair 8GB DDR4 2400MHz SODIMM RAM (around $40-$50)
* Kingston 8GB DDR4 2400MHz SODIMM RAM (around $35-$45)

These modules are widely available and should work with your Dell Inspiron laptop. However, to ensure compatibility, I recommend checking the following:

1. Dell's website: Check your laptop's support page on Dell's website to see if they list compatible RAM upgrades.
2. Manufacturer's website: Check the websites of the RAM manufacturers I mentioned above to see if they have a compatibility tool or list for your specific laptop model.
3. Online marketplaces: Check online marketplaces like Amazon or Newegg to see if other customers have successfully used these RAM modules with your laptop model.

Before making a purchase, make sure to double-check the specifications and compatibility to ensure the RAM module will work with your laptop.

Also, don't forget to handle the RAM modules by the edges to prevent static electricity damage, and follow proper installation procedures to avoid damaging your laptop's motherboard.

If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask!
